intro: Farrago racemosa, commonly known as the clustered fern, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its dense, clustered growth habit and its slender, branching stems. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy surface. Farrago racemosa produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in racemes, often giving the plant a delicate appearance.
